textBeforeTable: Supported parameters: Syntax: %FORMFIELD{"fieldname"}% FORMFIELD{"fieldname"} -- renders a field in the form attached to some topic Related: SEARCH, ENCODE, FormattedSearch For more sophisticated handling of string lists, consider installing Foswiki:Extensions.FilterPlugin. The FORMAT macro is currently only of use in formatting lists of topics, or of simple strings. It will be extended in future releases to add the capability to render other object types. $comma. $item will return the position of the item in the list (1-based), and the item itself, respectively. Note that a comma can be embedded in the data using the standard formatting token $index and type="string" then the comma separated list is treated as a list of strings. In this case, the format tokens If format tokens. $pager). In addition, the macro supports all the standard $nhits, $ntopics, $count, $pattern, $formfield, $formname, $changes, $summary, $createwikiusername, $createwikiname, $createusername, $createdate, $wikiusername, $wikiname, $username, $rev, $item, $index, $isodate, $date, $locked, $text, $parent, $topic, $web, FormattedSearch ( any of the topic-specific format tokens specified in type="topic" (the default) the format string can contain Supported formatting tokens If Related: SEARCH }% footer=" 1 =default=" format=" 1 =$topic=" header="the Skin setting is evaluated in this order:" %FORMAT{"%SKIN%" %FORMAT{"one,two,three" type="string" format=" *
textAfterTable: $dow day of the week (Sun = 0) 2 $week number of week in year (ISO 8601) 34 $month short name of month Dec $mo 2 digit month 12 $year 4 digit year 1999 $ye 2 digit year 99 $tz either "GMT" (if set to gmtime), or "Local" (if set to servertime) GMT $iso ISO format timestamp 2015-07-28T10:25:07Z $rcs RCS format timestamp 2015/07/28 10:25:07 $http E-mail & http format timestamp Tue, 28 Jul 2015 10:25:07 GMT $epoch
